newsitem.title: USA: PG&E Diablo Canyon 2 nuclear unit trips off line.
newsitem.headline: PG&E Diablo Canyon 2 nuclear unit trips off line.

text.p: Pacific Gas and Electric Corp (PG&E) said its 1,073 megawatt (MW) Diablo Canyon 2 nuclear power station automatically tripped off line Saturday.

In its report to the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC), the San Francisco-based company said the unit tripped off line at 1057 PST Saturday due to "low water level in the number 2-2 steam generator."
The unit was listed by the NRC in its Monday daily plant status report as being in "mode 3 - hot standby", which would indicate a prompt restart is likely.
PG&E, in its status report to the NRC, gave Tuesday, April 1, as the unit's likely restart date.
The company could not be immediately reached for confirmation of the estimated restart.
The unit, in Avila Beach, California, was operating at full power when it tripped off line.
The facility's neighboring unit, Diablo Canyon 1, is operating at full power. It is also rated at 1,073 MW.
